About MMI Asia MMI Asia is a full subsidiary of one of the world largest and leading exhibition organizers; Messe München GMBH (MMG). MMI Asia established in Singapore in 1992, is now embarking on a significant growth and expansion program, bringing some of MMG’s world leading brands to the ASEAN market. Through a combination of, geo clones, partnerships, joint-ventures, M&A and new greenfield launches, MMI Asia is growing its team in Singapore with exceptional, ambitious and innovative staff to assist the company’s growth strategies.  The Role The Sales Executive / Manager will take responsibility for the relationship building and account management of MMI Asia and MMG’s key clients both in Singapore and across the region. The role ensures that client participation in exhibitions and events overseas are seamless and valuable. The position will also support MMI Asia’s show teams to grow exhibition stand, sponsorship, and digital sales for their respective exhibitions.  Responsibilities For MMG international events: Provide detailed information about all Messe München events to exhibitors, visitors, trade association and media representatives located in Singapore Acquisition of exhibitors and visitors Implement tailored promotions, including the formation of Singapore pavilions Work with international project teams regarding exhibitors’ participation Provide support for application formalities, visa application, stand placement etc. Provide information about grant opportunities through government agencies or associations for exhibitor’s trade fair participation  For MMI Asia regional events: Support the show teams for new business acquisition Exhibition stand, sponsorship and digital sales Source, build and maintain a thorough client database Ensure accurate reporting and pipeline management Establish new and strengthen existing relationships with clients Conduct competitive intelligence  Key Skills and experience ·      2+ years in the international exhibition/event industry ·      Proficiency in English, both written and spoken ·      Commercial flair with the ability to innovate ·      Proactive and ambitious in nature is a must for this position ·      Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and observe tight deadlines ·      Familiar with Microsoft office & Salesforce ·      Self-motivated individual with good team spirit

200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.  Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years.   About the role  As a regional key account manager, you will ensure the delivery of expected outcomes along with providing high quality services to our FMCG customers. Reporting to the Head of FMCG Vertical in ASPAC, the role is expected to manage, develop and facilitate growth of existing and targeted accounts within the FMCG Vertical.  It will be your responsibility to come up with strategies to develop and/or maintain Bollore’s position with existing and prospective FMCG accounts. You will also be required to work cross-functionally to participate in tender opportunities, draft legal contracts, as well as generate performance reports in order to position Bollore towards successful business acquisitions.   What you will be doing  Extend Bollore’s reach within Asia Pacific region  Identify Key Account targets in Asia Pacific region Study the FMCG market, inclusive but not limited to, competitors, carriers, manufacturers, market trends, fluctuations and changes. Work with Vertical Lead to develop, grow & capture market share among existing and targeted FMCG accounts with the ASPAC Region Effectively Interact with our network to support overall FMCG development, work with local sales teams in achieving targeted growth for each entity Act as internal consultant and share know-how about the vertical Send sales leads to network in order to increase Bollore Logistics’ presence in ASPAC Establish a referencing strategy for regional or international accounts Develop relationships with prospective key accounts to promote Bollore Logistics and obtain the opportunity to participate for future tenders Represent Bollore Logistics to lead and participate in tender process (RFP/RFI/RFQ) for FMCG accounts Promote Bollore Logistics services and key Asia stations and regions Implement new business strategies to gather sales leads and expand new FMCG customer base  Service support  Determine a tariff policy in conjunction with Middle Office and Regional Sales Management Participate in negotiations with suppliers Monitor customer account profitability and problems linked to receipts with site managers Transfer obtained contracts to Operations team in order to provide high quality service to customers Support services or operation sites through advising on relevant SOPs  Synthesis of information Consolidate statistical elements from various operations for reporting purposes Report sales actions undertaken to further develop key customer accounts Update CRM with weekly activities and monthly reports for key accounts   The successful applicant  Essential  Bachelor’s degree and above At least 10 years’ experience in a fast paced and dynamic MNC environment Prior experience in the logistics/warehousing industry Prior experience in key account management (preferably in ASPAC region) Exceptional business development, relationship management & communication skills  Desirable  Prior experience in FMCG vertical Strong network/contacts of FMCG decision makers in Asia Pacific Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite Good sales and analytical skills Customer-centric mindset Self-starter Highly adaptable    Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.

Company Description  Imagine what we can do together. At LinkedIn, we believe amazing things can happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging and their ideas are heard. Join us and help make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can.  Job Description  As a Relationship Manager working in a pod structure in our customer expansion business, you will partner closely with the LinkedIn Sales Solutions Enterprise Relationship Manager to partner with existing customers and expand our footprint through repeatable commercial plays and by aligning LinkedIn’s portfolio of professional solutions with the complex requirements of our largest regional and multinational customers (MNC).  The Enterprise customer business in LinkedIn Sales Solutions focuses on green space accounts (existing customers/logos) and accelerates our penetration in the Enterprise segment in Asia through deep client understanding, strategic relationship network and strong value creation. Ready to join this exciting group?  Responsibilities  You will partner with the Enterprise Relationship Manager (RM) to jointly develop account and territory plans, using external and internal data/insights to prioritise accounts, formulate sales strategies and execution tactics to grow existing customers. There will be direct customer expansion accountability and ownership within a subset of the Enterprise RM territory.  This role will also lead the development of quarterly plans to engage and nurture key customer communities as part of a larger pod community of Relationship Managers and Relationship Managers (RM).  This is a highly collaborative role requiring a passion for building strong and lasting relationships which allow our largest customers to be, and feel, successful with LinkedIn products and solutions. Aligned to a pod structure, collaborate and partner with the Enterprise RM’s to agree upon account goals, strategies and tactics for customer growth and then contribute on territory and account plans Proactively identify opportunities in buying centers, subsidiaries and divisions where pilot play(s) can be positioned. As required, conduct detailed discovery and needs analysis with both decision makers and end users to recommend the right LinkedIn Solution. Establish a trusted and multi-threaded relationship with your allocated accounts by providing high-quality customer engagement activities, leveraging x-functional partners and regional/global executives. Be open, collaborative and customer-focused in all communications and transactions with colleagues and clients. Use our CRM every day for tracking activities and, most importantly, forecasting. Speak at client & industry events across APAC in partnership with the Enterprise AE to generate demand and ensure attendance at various LinkedIn marketing & thought leadership events Thought leadership initiatives. As part of the AE/RM pod community, impact strategic and multi-threaded engagement within your territory through a planned and deliberate approach to engaging and nurturing targeted client communities (CXO, Sales/BU Leaders, CMO, Sales Operations, Program Leads/Managers, etc.)  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: 3+ years of sales and business development experience selling to Enterprise accounts.  Preferred Qualifications: Excellent communications, team collaboration and analytical skills. Experience in multi-threaded engagement, selling to EVPs, CXOs and end-users (in the same sales cycle) in both individual and team sales environments Experience in solution selling to large regional/global customers, with complex organization structure Experience in managing multiple pilot projects. Demonstrated success in driving new business sales, and ability to develop and manage a sales execution plan at an account and/or territory level. Proven success in selling SaaS or disruptive technology in an Enterprise environment.  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.  All Dublin, Ireland jobs at LinkedIn are available under our ReturnIn Scheme, for people returning to work from family or care responsibilities. This will include extra support through interview stage, and if successful, an extended induction according to your needs. To access the scheme just let your recruiter know that you're a returner when you apply. Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice

Company Description  Imagine what we can do together. At LinkedIn, we believe amazing things can happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging and their ideas are heard. Join us and help make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can.  Job Description  LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers. Everyday millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. Our mission is to create economic opportunity for every member of the workforce.  At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works and take that leap in your career transformation journey.  The Opportunity  We are looking for a Sales Manager to lead a team of Regional Account Managers within our Global Clients Program (GCP) in growing and maintaining relationships with our most strategic global customers. Your team will be responsible for learning the entire suite of LinkedIn’s Talent Solutions, understanding how they are used and valued by our customers, and making compelling recommendations for additional investments and renewals in LinkedIn.  Your team will be responsible for a book of current customers, involvement in large centralized global contracts and outbound activity within the long tail of your portfolio. Your team will also partner with a select group of global clients to identify solutions that can help them achieve their business and talent objectives.  LinkedIn provides a flexible, high-growth environment where dedicated sales professionals are given the opportunity to excel and be recognized for outstanding results. LinkedIn’s sales team consists of smart, ambitious, and collaborative individuals who excel at leadership, leverage, results, and enhancement of corporate culture.  Responsibilities  Develop and execute a focused sales strategy to renew and expand the customer base for our Global Clients Enterprise. Drive a culture of forecasting excellency across the team and similarly prepare and present accurate sales forecasts to senior management. Prioritize initiatives, create focus for the team and hold them accountable to the use of systems, tools, sales process, and methodology. Directly manage the day-to-day operations of the team with the ability to grow and scale, as necessary. Manage escalations and participate directly in all aspects of the sales cycle to ensure customer and member satisfaction. Be directly involved with the mentorship and development of the team including recruiting, hiring, training and compassionately performance managing new Regional Account Managers. You should have a particular emphasis on coaching and be fully conversant in relation to our Value Engagement and Blueprint methodologies. Ability to build and foster strong cross-functional partnerships. Collaborate with senior leadership to define segment strategy and lead high impact initiatives to fuel new growth areas. Excellent communication skills including active listening, written and verbal across all channels. Demonstrated commitment to building diverse teams and fostering an inclusive team culture.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: 8+ years of quota-carrying sales experience. 2+ years of direct people management experience Experience working with Global Clients or Enterprise customers  Preferred Qualifications: A demonstrated track record of exceeding sales targets. Cross-functional partnership, account team, solution selling, team selling environment experience. Experience with managing through significant change. Expertise in the understanding and application of relevant sales methodologies and metrics. Ability to evaluate sound business opportunities and close deals. Strong knowledge of CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tools to manage sales-related activities. Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize multiple projects and to guide/direct others. Strong oral/written communication and negotiating skills. Excellent client management, presentation skills and conflict resolution ability. A history of strong Executive level client relationships.  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.  All Dublin, Ireland jobs at LinkedIn are available under our ReturnIn Scheme, for people returning to work from family or care responsibilities. This will include extra support through interview stage, and if successful, an extended induction according to your needs. To access the scheme just let your recruiter know that you're a returner when you apply. Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. Experience in advertising, sales, marketing, consulting or media.  Preferred qualifications: 8 years of experience in sales, in integrated marketing communications or media sales. 6 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting or media in the technology industry. Experience working in advertising sales environment or within the Go-to-Market aspect of a product organization. Experience with partner relations, account management, and sales skills.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and customer-focused members help entrepreneurs build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. In this role, you will collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends, and create and implement business plans for all types of businesses.  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Oversee and define the product solutions strategy of both performance (Search, Display and Shopping), video (YouTube), and partner with sales teams to influence accounts and achieve in-market business growth objectives. Present Google products with structure, best practice case studies, demonstrations, and data. Build the global product strategy and influence global product roadmap. Provide product updates and insights to our teams and partners. Keep up with internal and external product news and advertising market trends that would have impact on our success. Engage regularly with customers and agency partners together with our initial contact teams to assist in promoting products and stay attuned to their challenges and needs.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

THE COMPANY Singapore E-Business is an exciting fintech company incorporated in 2014. We believe in empowering businesses globally in the digital economy through innovative solutions, helping businesses accelerate growth through integrated payments, financing, and our suite of value-added solutions. With our specialized B2B payment solutions, we solve the biggest pain point that is plaguing the industry, Cash flow optimization for buyers and Cash collection for suppliers. This is enabled through EzyPayments, where buyers are given up to 60 days interest free credits when payments to suppliers are triggered, while suppliers can receive payments due to them within 2-5 days. In addition, we are proud to be part of the government’s initiative to pilot collections via digital means as opposed to the traditional paper GIRO setup. This is a game changer as it will allow seamless and efficient customer onboarding and faster payment collections to any organization. Underpinning EzyPayments will include our suite of value – added solutions, which collectively is a one stop Procure-to-Pay B2B cloud-based platform that connects both buyers and suppliers seamlessly. We specialize in 1) Procurement automation, 2) Accounts payable automation and 3) Payment automation. In this day and age, we believe that productivity is an entitlement. Our aim is to deliver productivity to the buyer and supplier relationship, enabling business to allocate more time for growth. With the massive amounts of data flowing through our platform, we also provide analytics for businesses to embrace data driven growth to make smarter decisions and access to financing.  THE TEAM The Business Development Team (BDT) is responsible for all sales-led initiatives, from lead generation to closures. As we are growing a new product segment in the electronic collection and payments space, we are expecting a strong sales pipeline of high-value deals with Enterprise and SME clients. The BDT team identifies clients whom we can add value to their current procurement to payment processes. This team encompasses high energy members with high expectations in quality output for their clients. The BDT team members focuses on cross industries clients, and have end-to-end skill sets to gap identification, creation of value to clients, negotiation, building relationship and managing key stakeholders.  THE ROLE As we are launching the new e-collection/ e-payment solution, we are looking for a team member to join our BDT team as a Business Development Executive with the full-time role below:  Responsibilities: •       Deal creation and account management (end-to-end CRM) for enterprise or SME sales •       Identifying, negotiating, and executing new deals •       Growing existing and new accounts, including identification and sales of cross product •       Responsible for achieving business and sales objective / targets •       Identifying client’s strategic priorities and interests •       Negotiating, presenting, and closing attractive business deals and ensuring mutually beneficial commercial terms that are in line with business objectives and strategy •       Reaching out to targeted and manage existing key clients to sell, upsell, and cross sell to expand their sales volumes and maintain positive long-term relationships. •       Execute marketing activities and demand generation campaigns •       Develop innovative new methods of cooperation •       Handle account management matters and be the point of contact for customers •       Work with cross functional teams to coordinate pre-sales, post-sales, and support resources to drive successful closure and implementation for customers Attend industry functions, such as association events and conferences, and provide feedback and information on market and creative trends. •       Coordinating and supporting communication plans for enhanced visibility and influence with targeted audiences.  Expected skills and experience: •       3-5 years of working experience in business development, enterprise sales, or B2B sales •       Self-directed prospecting skills •       Striving to meet and exceed sales goals •       Experience working with stakeholders to find win-win solutions •       Demonstrate the ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization •       Excellent interpersonal skills and entrepreneur mindset •       Self-motivated with a results-driven approach •       Understanding of payments products and industry will be a plus
jobFunction: Business Development, Information Technology, and Project Management
industries: Financial Services and Information Technology and Services

description: Responsibilities: Responsible for professional handling of all customer inquiries. Provides quotation on products selling & solution to best meet customers’ requirement. Follow up of quotations and order coordination to establish high level of customer satisfaction. Collaborating with marketing team in products promotion and conduct market research in related segments to improve sales. Independent, resourceful and proactive in lead generation, prospecting, accounts management and support in developing sales strategies to meet sales targets. Involve in pre-sales presentation, customer training, outbound calls activities, develop and manage new account to expand customer breadth and sales performance.  Requirements: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelors’ Degree, in Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent. At least 2 years of corporate sales experience with good technology knowledge in the Industrial Equipment Manufacturing, Embedded Modules Computing and Industrial 4.0. Enthusiastic in learning new technology and strong commitment in customer service. Self-motivated, analytical, team player and able to work independently with good communication and presentation skills. Added advantage for candidate with experience or familiar in following industries : Embedded Computing markets related to Equipment makers, Smart Cities, Surveillance, Military, Edge Analytics and Gaming computing. Healthcare, Logistics/Fleet Application, Retail/Kiosks solution, POS & tablets, Signage etc. Factory automation or Machine builders, Automated Testing Systems, Industrial Communication or Semiconductor industries.   Advantech Co. Singapore Pte Ltd ADVANTECH is the world leader in Embedded & Applied Computing, eAutomation and Industrial & Network computing platforms. With a global presence and an extensive network of offices worldwide, we manufacture and integrate advanced industrial computing platforms and provide system expertise to system integrators for their solution needs. In ADVANTECH, Our culture empowers our people to achieve their true potential and creativity. We believe in sharing success with our people and in listening to the many voices that work together to support our single vision. We are looking for aspiring talents to join our fast-growing and dynamic organization!

Job Description Propine is re-inventing capital markets using blockchain technology. We’ve worked with the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS), to become the first licensed custodian for digital assets.  We are looking for a highly motivated Business Development Manager to join our Sales team. The immediate focus of this role is to drive incremental revenue opportunities for our digital asset servicing and custody business. Working closely with the CEO, the Business Development Management is responsible for bringing in sales and creating a strong partner network for future growth.   Job Requirements ●      Accountable for generating new revenue based on pre-agreed targets ●      Generate new business leads and cross-sell opportunities, ensuring a robust pipeline of new opportunities ●      Prepare business proposals and conduct commercial negotiations with stakeholders ●      Prepare and review contracts with clients ●      Have in-depth knowledge of digital asset servicing products and value proposition for different verticals in this space, keeping abreast of industry trends both locally and internationally ●      Demonstrating a strong understanding of the digital ecosystem and be able to explain product benefits to clients and prospects ●      Identifying and mapping existing product capability with client needs, then working closely with internal product and operation stakeholders to bridge and support the needs of our clients ●      Support marketing efforts   Qualifications ●      A tertiary qualification is preferable ●      Min 2-4 years of experience in a sales/business development related role ●      Experience in crypto will have a strong edge ●      Sound understanding of financial markets is an advantage ●      Ability to think strategically and tactically ●      Excellent organization skills ●      Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills ●      Strong financial analysis skills ●      Self-motivated, able to work successfully as an individual contributor or as a team member ●      Organized with attention to detail; proven ability to conceptualize, plan and execute ideas while providing training and skills transfer to others
industries: Information Technology and Services and Financial Services

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  What You’ll Be Doing …  The Business Development Representative (BDR) are tasked with strategically developing and qualifying revenue opportunities within their assigned territory. BDR work closely with their Account Executives in a business development capacity. Candidates for this position must be highly motivated, tenacious, and self starters.  We are currently seeking high-energy, driven professionals with sound business acumen and natural sales instincts to join our fast-paced and dynamic team. Ideal candidates should be eager to advance through a clearly defined learning and earning path. Salesforce.com offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be provided the tools, resources and outstanding leadership to sell business application solutions and take your career to the next level!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Generate new business opportunities to fuel the sales Pipeline for our products across our Enterprise Accounts Create and prioritize strategic target account lists within India. Research and build "cold accounts" (i.e.: adding contacts, sending emails, cold calling) Consistently meet or exceed monthly sales targets/quotas. Conduct high level conversations with Senior Executives in prospect accounts Evangelize Salesforce and the On-Demand model  Who You Are … Experienced.Relevant experience in sales and/or lead qualification (including outbound prospecting). Domain.Experience with lead qualification at all levels within organizations – managers, directors, VPs, executives. Effective Communicator.You are clear and persuasive in both verbal and written English communications with highly effective use of email and telephone. Technically Savvy.Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools. Performer. Ability to work in a high energy, fast ‐ paced sales environment You are a Recruiter!Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!  Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. The acquisition closed on August 1, 2019, and Tableau is a wholly-owned subsidiary of salesforce.com, inc.  Accommodations- If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Collaborate with Sales Leaders on driving key business objectives Responsible for incentives and KPI setting, headcount planning and development of future strategies Business performance evaluation Produce weekly/monthly operational reports for Sales Team and Sales Management Produce ad hoc reports/analysis for Sales Leadership team Initiate BD Projects that help our sales teams perform better Uncover and implement policies and processes to increase productivity, efficiency, and accuracy within our sales teams Lead Generation  Requirements Good university degree 1-3 years of experience in a Sales Operations / Sales Analyst / Business Analyst / Consulting role Experience assessing Sales Capacity and developing Sales KPI as well as corresponding Incentive Plans

After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  We are looking for someone to Amplify and Supercharge our sales teams by: Collaborating with Sales Leaders on driving key business objectives Being responsible for incentives and KPI setting, HC planning and Development of future strategies Evaluating business performance Producing weekly/monthly operational reports for Sales Team and Sales Management Producing ad hoc reports/analysis for Sales Leadership team Initiating BD Projects that help our sales teams perform better Uncovering and implementing policies and processes to increase productivity, efficiency, and accuracy within our sales teams Generating leads  In short, we are looking for an experienced analyst in sales strategy and operations, who can play as a trusted advisor to the sales leadership team.  Requirements: University degree 1-3 years of experience in a Sales Operations / Sales Analyst / Business Analyst / Consulting role Experience assessing Sales Capacity and developing Sales KPI as well as corresponding Incentive Plans
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: MacGregor shapes the offshore and marine industries by offering world-leading engineering solutions and services with a strong portfolio of MacGregor, Hatlapa, Porsgrunn, Pusnes and Triplex brands. Shipbuilders, owners and operators are able to optimise the lifetime profitability, safety, reliability and environmental sustainability of their operations by working in close cooperation with us.  Purpose of the position Lead, direct and develop the front line sales teams across the countries within the Region to ensure that their activities meet the organization’s business objectives & targets. Work within a team comprising all other Regional Account Managers and Product Managers to ensure a global approach is taken to all field sales activities and initiatives Key Tasks And Responsibilities Development and ownership of sales strategy for the assigned area, using guidelines and policies in line with the divisional business strategy. Responsibility for sales growth: managing sales & service campaigns, generation of market intelligence and active relationship management towards existing and new customers. Manage key regional accounts. Participate actively in regular account meetings with Product Managers to ensure correct market feedback is provided. Ownership of all sales KPIs for the region Challenge, guide, develop and coach sales team members to reach their targets and continuously improve key skills; develop and lead implementation of new process excellence initiatives, including organization set-up, resourcing, and cost control for improved efficiencies. Manage the operational activities of the regional sales team including visit planning and reporting. Prepare sales and service sales forecasts and budgets; monitor sales volume, revenues, and costs against forecasts to identify problem areas; and adapt procedures or re-allocate resources to improve the overall performance of the sales team. Actively encourage team to report back on customers product Installed Base (IB) What You’ll Need To Succeed  Education Bachelor’s degree in engineering, marine or business Experience 6+ years in Marine, shipping or offshore Competencies Fluent English – written and oral Ability to manage a team across different geographies Ability to manage and interpret sales and cost data and communicate results to the sales team Responsibility for conforming to the Cargotec Code of Conduct, QEHS Policies of MacGregor as well as requirements of ISO9001, ISO14001 and OHSAS18001 You Will Be Part Of  We offer you an opportunity to put your skills and experience to work and make an impact in our global organisation. You will work together with great colleagues from various backgrounds inspired by shared, ambitious goals. We value collaboration in our open and inclusive culture. With us, you will have the opportunity to develop yourself professionally. Join us to make a difference - and have fun while doing it.  Interested to join?  If you are excited about this opportunity, click on Apply Now and send us your updated CV and expected salaries.  MacGregor is part of Cargotec  MacGregor shapes the offshore and marine industries by offering world-leading engineering solutions and services with a strong portfolio of MacGregor, Hatlapa, Porsgrunn, Pusnes and Triplex brands. Shipbuilders, owners and operators are able to optimise the lifetime profitability, safety, reliability and environmental sustainability of their operations by working in close cooperation with MacGregor.  MacGregor solutions and services for handling marine cargoes, vessel operations, offshore loads,crude/LNG transfer and offshore mooring are all designed to perform with the sea. www.macgregor.com  MacGregor is part of Cargotec. Cargotec's (Nasdaq Helsinki: CGCBV) sales in 2020 totalled approximately EUR 3.3 billion and it employs around 11,500 people. www.cargotec.com
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Mechanical or Industrial Engineering, and Oil & Energy

description: Company Description  Imagine what we can do together. At LinkedIn, we believe amazing things can happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging and their ideas are heard. Join us and help make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can.  Job Description  We are looking for a  Account Executive (Talent Solutions)  to join our team in tapping into potential client opportunities and generating new business for corporate accounts ranging from start-ups to large enterprises in Singapore.  What You’ll Do: Prospect relentlessly to build pipeline and build strong personal relationships with prospects Create reliable forecasts and be completely transparent with management on the pipeline status Close new business consistently at or above quota level Develop and execute on a strategic plan for the territory and document and distribute competitive information Invest in colleagues and give coaching and advice when you see an opportunity for improvement Work to develop and circulate the set of best practices that will be the foundation of this team Travel (approximately 10%)  What Success Looks Like: Listen to the needs of the market and share insights with product and marketing teams Be proactive about solving problems even if it’s outside of your area and be ready to take on additional initiatives and responsibilities as they emerge Seek out opportunities to be a leader and do everything you can to help the company achieve its larger objectives  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: BA/BS degree in a related field or equivalent experience 3+ years of experience in a quota-carrying sales role  Preferred Qualifications: Experience with recruiting, recruitment media and HR software Experience with SaaS opportunities and Salesforce.com platform Experience selling IT or recruiting solutions Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions Strong negotiation and accurate forecasting skills Demonstrated ability to find, manage and close high-level business in an evangelist sales environment Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to inform decision making and persuade others Ability to manage a large number of prospect situations simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competitors  You’ll Benefit From Our Culture  We  strongly believe in the well-being of our employees and their families. That’s why we offer generous health and wellness programs and time away for employees of all levels. Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice

Description: Sales Account/ Project Manager  Responsibilities include:  1.     Maintain excellent relationships with existing Accounts and work closely with respective points-of-contact 2.     Develop excellent relationships with new Accounts and work closely with respective points-of-contact 3.     Expand on sales / project business opportunities with existing Accounts 4.     Manage and upkeep Sales Order Forms 5.     Coordinate deliveries with Customer Service team 6.     Initiate quarterly bulk order review and placement of sales orders 7.     Manage projects on day-to-day basis and ensure tasks are implemented on time, on budget and to the required scope and quality 8.     Lead special ad-hoc projects or duties that may be assigned by management from time to time 9.     Manage AR issues 10.  Reporting – Account meetings, store installations, store visits  Requirements: 1.     Background or experience with industrial engineering or product design 2.     Experience in retail industry, store construction, store fixture/fittings procurement 3.     Effective in English and Mandarin as candidate is required to communicate directly with China office staff)

We are a fast growing gaming technology company looking to expand in new international markets. The ideal candidate is a motivated, organised, and creative individual who welcomes the challenges of acquiring and developing new business through sales efforts. You will build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and close business deals while maintaining an extensive knowledge of current market conditions. The position has huge growth potential and we will build a team around you.  Responsibilities Cultivate strong business relationships with key decision makers Proactively identify new opportunities and deliver innovative solutions to customers Develop market strategies by researching lists of high potential prospects  Qualifications High integrity and motivation to succeed Excellent communicator in both Chinese and English Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business Independent team player and works well under pressure Experience in business development operations or similar roles or gaming industry will be a plus but not a must as we are open to all talents with potentials
